lines.text: You'd think I set a blow torch to the American flag. What's a man for if he can't aim high, ma'am?
What do you want me to talk about?
I have no intention of wasting sympathy on him.
Sympathy is never wasted, Betty Lee. One way or another, you get it back, or so it says in the Book.
Back to the house, Betty Lee. You get off this property, son, kite and all!
I'm sorry, sir, if you think that I'm...
I've not the slightest concern what you think. Get back to your folks in their wallow. You're all a lot of pigs.
Daddy, stop! If you have something to say...
Don't you answer back. You didn't come to church. Get to the house, and help your ma put dinner on. No child of mine gets taught ungodly things on the Sabbath or any other day.
If you weighed it on a scale, you could find more godliness here in this sun and air than in that church of yours.
Don't you come around here again. I'll not have it. Where's God? I don't know. He takes a boy like my son off in the war and leaves a loafer and braggart like you alive.
I wanna get out of here. I'm young. I want a good time out of life.
Then do it, hun. Paint your toenails red and run away.

It needs a man to go to Hell with, because that's what I want. Hours and hours of Heaven that just slides on down to Hell and we don't care how or when it ends. You're wild, Glenn, just like me. Unhappy wild!
